results.title: If I should fall from grace: the Shane MacGowan story
results.creator_credit: Sarah Share, Emdee 2000 Productions, TG4 and Irish Film Board
results.brief_description: This Irish documentary plots the legendary musician Shane MacGowan’s rise to fame, and infamy, as the lead singer of Irish band “The Pogues” and his subsequent dismissal. Along with footage of live performances, video clips and an extended contemporary interview with MacGowan, this documentary also contains illuminating discussions with friends, family, colleagues, and fellow musicians Nick Cave, Philip Chevron, and Paul Simonon from “The Clash”. Extensive footage from MacGowan’s past, in particular performances from the 1970s and 80s, presents an artist influenced by the traditions of Irish music and song, but also spurred on by the anti-establishment ethos and damaging excesses of the Punk Rock movement. Sarah Share presents an honest and compelling portrait of an evidently talented musician whose addiction to drugs and alcohol has seriously impeded his ambition and ability to maintain stability, in life and in his art. Songs featured include: Paddy public enemy No 1, If I should fall from grace with God, Infatuation, Gabrielle, Waxie’s dargle, Streams of whiskey, Dirty old town, The Irish rover, Fiesta, A Rainy night in Soho, Fairytale in New York, White city, Summer in Siam, Song with no name, That woman’s got me drinking, Haunted and Lonesome highway.
results.title_for_label: If I should fall from grace: the Shane MacGowan story

results.title: If ever I see you again
results.brief_description: A film you will either love or hate - but certainly one for the romantics out there. This is pure 70s in every way, especially the music and the fashion. “If ever I see you again” is a story of first love lost and broken in the winter of 1966 and rekindled once more in the winter of 1978. Bob Morrison (Joe Brooks), a jingle writer in New York and widowed with two children takes up an opportunity to create music for a movie in California. On reaching California, Bob who has never forgotten his first teenage love, Jennifer Corly (Shelley Hack), finds that she is now living in California. Unable to resist seeking her out, Bob makes contact and the two, after a lot of soul-searching and comings and goings, eventually get it together. With love songs playing in the background, romantic scenes in the snow and warm Christmassy moments, what more can you ask for! This is Joe Brooks’ film - he produced, directed, starred, composed, arranged and conducted the music and wrote, along with Martin Davidson, the screenplay. Cast also includes Jimmy Breslin, Jerry Keller, Kenny Karen, George Plimpton.

results.title: If at first you don’t succeed
results.brief_description: Since 2015, Celeste Barber’s resisted the swarm of unattainable images on social media with her #celestechallengeaccepted project, an experiment to see how normal people look recreating the perfectly staged poses of the rich and Insta-famous

constellations_primary.name: If at first you don't succeed
constellations_primary.description: Though originally intended as a laugh, Celeste Baber’s social media posts have become examples of body positivity to her eight million followers and challenge the absurd expectations put on women in society.

results.description:
This video features in a responsive display in the museum that presents the moments, stories and memes capturing the zeitgeist by going viral on the internet.

Smartphones aren’t a mirror, but the images and videos influencers and celebrities post on social media can seem like standards we should reflect. Australian comedian Celeste Barber isn’t aspiring to these unrealistic ideals. Since 2015, Barber’s resisted the swarm of air-brushed and unattainable images with her #celestechallengeaccepted project, an experiment to see how normal people look recreating the perfectly staged poses of the rich and Insta-famous. Though originally intended as a laugh, Barber’s posts have become examples of body positivity to her eight million followers and challenge the absurd expectations put on women in society.
description_for_label:
This video features in a responsive display in the museum that presents the moments, stories and memes capturing the zeitgeist by going viral on the internet.

Smartphones aren’t a mirror, but the images and videos influencers and celebrities post on social media can seem like standards we should reflect. Australian comedian Celeste Barber isn’t aspiring to these unrealistic ideals. Since 2015, Barber’s resisted the swarm of air-brushed and unattainable images with her #celestechallengeaccepted project, an experiment to see how normal people look recreating the perfectly staged poses of the rich and Insta-famous. Though originally intended as a laugh, Barber’s posts have become examples of body positivity to her eight million followers and challenge the absurd expectations put on women in society.

details.label: Curatorial section
display_values: The Story of the Moving Image → Moving Minds → 09. Catch of the Day

images.caption: If at first you don’t succeed (Celeste Barber) (still)

results.title: If at first you don't succeed: you don't succeed [Colour version]
results.creator_credit: Peter Goodchild, Edward Goldwyn and BBC-TV
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Horizon”
If a mother does badly in bringing up her child in the first 5 years of his life, then the child has almost no chance of success in school. Child psychologists can now measure a new-born baby’s capacity for solving complex problems and they have found that the infant’s motivation is the sheer joy of solving the problems, but if the potential is not developed the damage is irreversible. The results of this research are having major implications for education.

results.title: If at first you don't succeed: you don't succeed (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Peter Goodchild, Edward Goldwyn and BBC-TV
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Horizon”
If a mother does badly in bringing up her child in the first 5 years of his life, then the child has almost no chance of success in school. Child psychologists can now measure a new-born baby’s capacity for solving complex problems and they have found that the infant’s motivation is the sheer joy of solving the problems, but if the potential is not developed the damage is irreversible. The results of this research are having major implications for education.
results.title_for_label: If at first you don’t succeed: you don’t succeed (TEFC)

results.title: If a boy can't learn
results.creator_credit: Lawrence A Williams, Susan S Trout and Lawren Productions
results.brief_description: Looks at the problem of a boy with learning disabilities, who is sent to a Learning Disabilities Center for diagnostic workup and testing. A specialist confers with the boy’s teachers and together they improvise ways of teaching to his strengths in order to compensate for his disabilities and help him learn. Excellent for teacher training and can be valuable to parents.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Lawrence A Williams, Susan S Trout and Lawren Productions
results.description: Looks at the problem of a boy with learning disabilities, who is sent to a Learning Disabilities Center for diagnostic workup and testing. Excellent for teacher training and can be valuable to parents.
